Text:
I'm using a new framework (http://320press.com/wpbs/) but the problem is it was developed using LESS. It also included CSS files, so I thought I would be able to simply delete the LESS files and be okay - however, when I did that, I would lose most of my styling.

Does anyone have a solution on the best way to achieve this? Most of the people i work with have yet to learn LESS so I need a framework we can work on as a team.

I'm using a new `framework` ***[Site Link][1]*** but the problem is it was developed using `LESS`. 

It also included `CSS` files, so I thought I would be able to simply delete the `LESS` files and be okay - however, when I did that, I would lose most of my **styling**.

Does anyone have a solution on the best way to achieve this? Most of the people i work with have yet to learn `LESS` so I need a `framework` we can work on as a team. 


  [1]: http://320press.com/wpbs/

> **Possible Duplicate:**  
> [Convert LESS nested CSS to standard CSS](http://stackoverflow.com/questions/4896500/convert-less-nested-css-to-standard-css)
